Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic view but oh the noisy trains!”
Reviews.Author: gazzaw10
Reviews.Content: As I was doing business in North Sydney the location was great. Very friendly reception staff & I was blown away by the view when I walked into my room. Disillusion set in about two minutes later when I heard what I thought was a low flying 747 fly over the hotel. A few minutes later there was another. It was then I realised that the loud rumbling was caused by trains arriving into the station located right by & under the hotel. They stopped at about 11pm but restarted about 5am - hardly condusive to a good nights sleep. Room service dinner was excellent. I rarely eat breakfast at my hotel as I refuse to pay the ridiculous amounts charged - at $30 Harbour View was no different. Plenty of excellent local cafes though.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: CSGDevizes
Reviews.Content: The views over the harbour particularly from the upper floors are truly magnificent. The room was clean and well furnished and the staff were friendly and helpful. Only problem was the windows are single glazed and even though we had a high level room the noise from bin lorries etc was intrusive.The sound insulation internally isn't great either and we were kept awake by noise from the corridor and adjoining rooms. Great views and a nice hotel - just bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, very handy for Nth Syd business”
Reviews.Author: JWood70
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred hotel when staying in Sydney on business. My company's headquarters are just a short walk away, but in general it's a very nice place to stay. The views out to the harbour are spectacular. I've not had dinner in the restaurant, but the breakfast is nice and what you'd usually expect. The staff are pleasant and there is a free shoe shine in the mornings. The bathrooms take a little getting used to though. There is a window with a clear view out to the harbour. No problem if you are staying on your own, but just remember to close the bathroom curtain if you are staying with your partner. :)

Reviews.Title: “Thank God it had million dollar views”
Reviews.Author: natmic
Reviews.Content: When staying at this hotel I was taken back twenty years as a backpacker travelling through Europe...sleeping on train stations! The only difference is that this had a more comfortable bed and they charged me for the experience. I thought that on my second night that moving to the 5th floor might be better in avoiding the train noise but instead I was also placed next to the elevator (which has luck had it broke down) and the noise from the underground train station is unbearable. It stopped around 12midnight and started up again around 5am. I booked this hotel for myself and about ten other work colleagues and I regretted every moment of my decision to stay here. We often have conferences around the corner so I booked it for convenience but never again. The staff were completely unsympathetic to my complaint about the noise. They obviously got it a lot. I also would avoid the restaurant...very ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: ryox
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by mistake! We were on our way to Sydney via a cruise ship and decided to spend a few extra days in Sydney. It was Mardi Grais and accommodation was hard to find so we were keen for anything!! What a find - fantastic harbour view, close to public transport, comfortable bed, friendly staff and did I mention the view! We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “North Sydney Harbourview Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevin p
Reviews.Content: ideal location, view most rooms having a view across sydney harbour breakfast is $30 for a full buffet a bit expensive when there are Cafes evrywhere across the road, the only down side is from 7am on train noise is quite loud if you like sleeping in and you have to pay for parking after paying $180 for a room, also no pool or gym pretty basic, rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Easy reach to city for work or play!”
Reviews.Author: Jakers7
Reviews.Content: Hotel a little dated but clean with friendly and very efficient staff..... Just two train stops from the city and one train stop from the Olympic pool for a quick dip or a visit to Luna Park or even a foreshore walk! Breakfast is pricy but you do have the option to have full or Continental at different prices, so your choice really. Local restaurants on Blue Street and at Milsons point mean you donâ€™t have to venture into the city to dine for your evening meal. Rooms have a great view of the harbour but are a little on the small side (reminded me a little European city rooms, especially Rome). Ask for a room higher up to take advantage of the view. The hotel sits above the main rail line but it doesnâ€™t really disturb you, more like a muffled noise than a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Dooligahl M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and son. Location was brilliant and the train , bus and taxi are close. A little noise from North Sydney station, but not too bad. Room was functional and clean and all staff friendly. The bar and restaurant are great and the restaurant has great views. All in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Romancing with a view!”
Reviews.Author: jum253
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for the weekend and booked the premium romance package, again! This is our second stay. We stayed in March last year for our 1st anni, and we decided to return to this hotel for our 2nd anni because of our fond memories. I cannot recommend highly enough this package, it is such great value! Wine, choc dipped strawberries, lindt chocs, 3 course meal, buffet breakfast, drink vouchers, late checkout and parking incl. all for under $400. The location of this hotel is amazing, just down the road from the beautiful Blues Point Reserve which has panoramic views of the harbour! The hotel is very easy to find. I think there was a private event on that wkend as the underground carpark was full, but luckily we got a spot right at the main entrance. The hotel kindly allowed us to reserve our spot with cones when we drove out to Blues Point at midnight. Check-in felt personal, professional and friendly. We were greeted with a 'welcome back' from the staff. We were in the deluxe room 1301, with the chocs, strawberries, and champagne flutes presented tastefully on the table on arrival. We also had a lovely 'welcome back' greeting card! The room was fresh and kept very clean. Yep, postcard views of the harbour! The hotel bed was exactly how we remembered it: like sleeping on a cloud! We were slightly disappointed with the rainshower (for which we were eager to use again lol), because the pressure was weak. Maybe it's due to the fact there were so many guests, I think there was a wedding on that night. LB's restaurant for dinner was amazing! We thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience. Their menu has changed a bit and our mains were of an amazing quality. Breakfast at 9am in LB's was full, so we were given the choice to sit on the comfortable chair and tables in Blues Bar. I honestly prefered this, as the restaurant was so full, it seemed chaotic, and the bar was away from all the noise! And the lounge chair was really comfortable! Breakfast was great, I missed their bircher muesli! I highly recommend this hotel and the premium romance package to couples. It's a nice and cheaper alternative to cbd hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, slightly noisy”
Reviews.Author: twisty1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for work and was happy with the room. It is a 1970-80s hotel that has been renovated, so the layout of the rooms is slightly old fashioned (small bathrooms). The furnishings and look of the rooms and very nice and the views are spectacular- ask for a low room number on a high floor for the best views (e.g. 801) as these are located on the right hand side of the hotel facing the harbour. Our room was directly above the train line, which was noisy even on the 8th floor. I found the bed too soft for my liking and the pillows were not comfortable (I am used to very firm pillows and bed...) The bathrooms were small, but had enough bench space to leave personal items. The bathrooms were renovated and quite nice. Room service was the price you would expect and the food was good. We did not have breakfast included, but felt that $30 was on the high side of what we wanted to pay (for the amount I eat). The location is brilliant- lovely downhill walk to Lavendar Bay where you can catch the ferry to Circular Quay or up river. It is opposite a shopping centre and above North Sydney Train station. It would be possible to walk into the city also across the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: HWWT
Reviews.Content: good location. short walk to trains. shops/eateries close by. great views. immaculately clean. bed is like lying on a cloud. best room service brekky ever. restaurant reliably good on numerous stays. staff helpful mostly. one recently on the desk is on a power trip and i hope she gets moved on before she spoils it! negatives = small bathroom - room only for one at a time! had a room once that didn't have harbour views and it was noisy with street noise and lift noise and only queen size bed. but, mostly it's been the good rooms, if you have booked enough in advance?

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: jujujulia
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel twice, and I love it. The views of North Sydney and the Harbour are beautiful, and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Lovely to have a bath to soak in, with nice ambient light in the room to really unwind after a hard day at the office. The room service menu is great quality -- I enjoyed a cheese plate and a lovely glass of wine. The in-hotel restaurant does a standard buffet breakfast with all the usual trimmings -- reasonably fresh, and sufficiently tasty. The dining menu is really quite good -- I absolutely adored the lamb ribs. Loved the attention to detail here, with the shoe shiner in residence in the mornings. Nice little pick me up on the way to work. Love staying here, although the location probably isn't super if you're a tourist who wants to walk to things. I wasn't really wowed by the restaurants in the near vicinity, but it was an easy train ride from North Sydney station to the CBD to get to some better restaurants. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: dunholme
Reviews.Content: Located almost next to a rail station with two stops to the city centre, taking only 5 minutes across the harbour bridge. Internal garage excellent and cost much less than many other Sydney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant view”
Reviews.Author: JKArnold
Reviews.Content: Having had a disappointing stay without a view at another hotel in North Sydney, we were delighted with our room at Harbourview. The view of the bridge and harbour is magnificent and can even be seen from the bathroom as it has a glass panel which allows you to look out if you wish. From our arrival the service was very good and even though breakfast was not included, it was satisfactory value for money. The location is very good, the hotel being a few steps away from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Love It for so many reasons and I'm sure you will too..”
Reviews.Author: Danskye
Reviews.Content: This review has been years in the making, I have stayed at this hotel over 12 times in the last 5 years and coming back again this week. This hotel draws me back every time, the staff are fantastic from check in to check out, the bar staff are friendly and the staff at the restaurant are fantastic, not to mention the chef, who is hands down the best ever chef, the food is incredible. The rooms are elegantly designed, the beds are very comfortable. I love this place and have even sent my in laws there for their wedding anniversary on the "Romancing package" and they loved it. I will continue to recommend and stay there, thanks to all the staff and keep up the good work but keep the rates down.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Harbor views!”
Reviews.Author: jacksl
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the view..get s upper floor because of the trains. Fantastic walks around the harbor

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the highest floor possible, and not just for the view”
Reviews.Author: yblieb
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night in this hotel with work. Nice hotel. Good sized room. The bed is very soft and it felt like a giant cloud. Very clean. The mini bar is fully stocked with assortments. Checking in the hotel employee wanted me to swipe my credit card, and pay for my room myself even though my work had paid everything. Thankfully I had printed out the itinerary that showed this before leaving Brisbane. Breakfast was very nice, and the view from the room was brilliant. A tip that I would give would be to ask for the highest possible floor they have. The train line runs directly underneath the hotel. I stayed in room 610, on the 6th floor and every 15 minutes the noise of the train was quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Play to Stay in North Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: mpmilestogo
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks at the Harbourview and enjoyed it immensely. The location is nice to reach the bridge, tour around North Sydney, or just relax at the hotel. I had a free weekend and walked the bridge both days to see various places on my own. Hotel staff were very nice with recommendations for meals and places for beer! Enjoyed the stay immensely.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Raymond Terrace, New South Wales, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Great stay close to transport.”
Reviews.Author: Julie U
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night at the Harbourview North Sydney. This Hotel was very good value. We had a room on the 13th floor looking right out over the Harbour Bridge so the view was spectacular. So close to North Sydney train station, literally a stone's throw. LB's restaurant for dinner that night was excellent. I was very impressed with the bathroom, despite it having the new large exposed window looking into the bedroom, but you can pull down the blind if you don't want your room mate seeing you shower. Other than that the bathroom had great lighting - most Hotels even some 5 star have very poor bathroom lighting and I find a hand mirror is essential to put on makeup, but the harbourview was excellent in that regard. A smallish room, but certainly adequate. I would go here again, hopefully for longer next time. You can hear the trains running underneath the building though as it's situated atop of North Sydney station, but this didn't bother us at all and I'm a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Tanmaier
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, with wonderful view of the bridge and harboue. Rooms are spacious, decor modern and new, and much easier to get to if you are deiving in than a hotel in town. We took a taxi into the city and it was about $12 so not far, and North Sydney railway station is right underneath. Highly convenient, but that is also the tradeoff - there is train noise so if you are bothered by that, dont stay here! Sydney trains dont go all night but they do start up early. However, dor me that isia food alarm - after all, here you are in one of the worlds great cities, why would you want to stay in bed? The restaurant has wonderful harbour views, and great food, though we went around the corner for breakfast, not being fond of the big smorgasbords on offer at hotels. The only other negative was the lifts were slow and if you are in the middle floors you might wait a while as many are full when they stop on the way down. But overall, we loved it and are going back.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home....”
Reviews.Author: Jamie F
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to North Sydney since about 2005 with work and have stayed at most of the hotels in the North Sydney area. The Harbourview is definitely my pick of the bunch. Besides the view which is undeniably one of the best views of Sydney city, it's the staff that make this place what it is. From check in to cleaners to bar staff and restaurant staff, they have always been courteous, professional, friendly but most of all, genuinely interested in making the stay there better. The Manager's drinks on a Wednesday night is always good for a beer or wine and some networking for business or friends. The rooms are exceptionally clean and for me the only criticism I have is that I don't like the shower heads...personal choice though. I've eaten in the restaurant and through room service and meal price, size and taste is exceptional. This really is my home away from home sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views of Sydney Harbour Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Clarker63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in December on holiday with my wife. The view is spectacular and we were fortunate to see a firework display in Lavender bay from the window. I wish I could stay there for the new year fireworks. Rooms are not lavish but functional. We stayed on the romancing with a view package, so we had evening meal included. This was variable but good once you spotted the best dishes on other peoples tables! Good value for a hotel in Sydney with the view and excellent transport options as the train is so close.

Reviews.Title: “Everything went well”
Reviews.Author: TaringaTravellers
Reviews.Content: Thanks to fellow Trip Advisor reviews, we knew to ask for a room with a harbour view and on a higher floor (to avoid the noise of the trains which run underneath the hotel). Our room was excellent and the views of the harbour are outstanding. We were there for four days just after New Year and both the Reception Staff and Breakfast Room Staff were extremely helpful and friendly in all instances. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Olive1920
Reviews.Content: The view here is of the back of the bridge as you are on the North shore but as advertised. It did mean that we didn't really get the full show of the fireworks on New Years Eve. Room was basic and on the small size and the furnishings could do with some updating but it was clean and comfortable with plentiful supplies of tea and coffee. Breakfast was very good as were the bar snacks. Staff were especially polite and it was nice to get a really friendly welcome on arrival. Stayed here for 4 nights over the New Years Eve period but would probably book around the Rocks area if going again and at any other time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in North Sydney with great views”
Reviews.Author: Heather T
Reviews.Content: Older style hotel recently refurbished, the beds are comfortable the location is excellent with easy access to North Sydney station. However the bathroom is very small and awkward

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with a great view”
Reviews.Author: Paula C
Reviews.Content: Great value-for-money hotel with gorgeous views of Sydney Harbour, the rooms are modern and fresh. Good location for families - an easy walk down to Lavender Bay and around to Luna Park. There is noises from trains below however we were on level 5 and the trains did not disturb us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with great view”
Reviews.Author: cebazat
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the Harbourview and always find it to be good value. Although it's over the train lines at North Sydney, the train noise doesn't bother us. This may be because we usually get a room on the top floors. The view of the Harbour Bridge is fantastic from every room on the harbour side. Service is always efficient and friendly. We stayed nights over Christmas again and were treated with a Christmas pudding in our room and bon bons at the dinner table.

Reviews.Title: “Stay of hotel for 5 days from 10th DEc to 15th Dec”
Reviews.Author: SmartVins
Reviews.Content: I hae requested to provide the higher floor but they have not entertained the request and provided the 2nd floor where there was lot of disturbance of train noise. Air con of the room was pathetic. over all experience was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and great value in room 1414!”
Reviews.Author: india70
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay and were given this room with a fantastic view of the harbour bridge and Milson's Point. We should have taken advantage of the $20 per day parking as we had an awful,time consuming journey in to the city courtesy of cityrail!The hotel is next door to North Sydney station so that was very convenient for us. I would have liked to have stayed longer. Great late checkout as well after a night out with friends. We are thinking of staying there to take our little girl out to the big city for the day and then to the zoo the following day. The rate was $167 a night which seemed to be the cheap for this time of year-all the other hotels were well over $250 in the same calibre.A short but graet stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, except for the train noise”
Reviews.Author: cashlm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for work. Picked the hotel due to it's location, close to our offices. Got a room on the 1st floor. View of the bridge and city was pretty good but the noise from the train was deafening! It sounded like a plane was landing! The overall cleanliness was fairly good although I did see some mould in the grout in the shower. Breakfast was pretty standard. One bonus though was that they had a sign on the buffet to show which dishes were gluten free (I'm a coeliac). Nice enough hotel but I wouldn't stay again due to the train noise

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view with some background noise”
Reviews.Author: Akketje
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with great views on the harbour bridge. Clean, comfortable beds, good location close to the north Sydney station. Downside is that it comes with some noise from the trains, but nothing you can't block out with good earplugs :-)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with great city views”
Reviews.Author: beentherejohn
Reviews.Content: Very well maintained hotel with terrific views of downtown Sydney and the bridge. With only a short walk to the train, a good location to get into downtown. Close to some good restaurants and pubs

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: alfo_girl
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great romance package of dinner, breakfast, parking, sparkling wine, chocolates. Best of all is the breathtaking view out of the window of Sydney Harbour. Our room was on the 12th floor so well away from the noise of the train station underneath the hotel. Dinner was delicious with plenty of choice with wine around $40-50 a bottle. Spent an hour at Luna Park squealing on the rides. What a great way to spend a day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing view”
Reviews.Author: KarinnaCraig
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay in this hotel just a few weeks ago on a work trip to Sydney. I lived in the Northern suburbs of Sydney up until 6 years ago and always chose city hotels to stay. I have stayed in some amaxing hotels in the CBD but the view from my room in The Harbourview Hotel was just awesome! I would recommend this hotel to anyway. I stayed on the 11th floor which was great but I have been told by other work collegues to request from level 7 and above or you will wake everytime a train goes under...Good service, very nice modern rooms and close to Blues Street for local cafes and restaurants...and just 2 train stops to the city! (5 mins)

Reviews.Title: “Train noise spoilt the stay.”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the Harbourview Hotel - standard queen $175. While conveniently located near the North Sydney train station, train noise from the second floor sounded like a low flying plane. My room did not have a harbour view, but it looked amazing from the lift area. The room and bathroom were both clean and modern. The room was a good size and had everything I required. The bed was comfortable, but the train noise interrupted my sleep. I probably won't stay here again, unless I could be guaranteed a room away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What views!”
Reviews.Author: DickBridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harbourview for the 3rd time on long weekend in October. As per usual, terrific. Make sure you ask for a room from 1-6 as opposed to 7 to 16, to get the best views of the harbour. And, as high up as possible - the noise from trains which pass under the hotel into Nth Sydney station can be louder on lower floors. Yes, beds are super soft and comfy. Dick Bridge Gosford NSW

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: trutraveller
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fantastic. Beautiful views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, and only a minutes walk from the train station which heads directly into the city. I never had any problem with noise from trains passing by, but I was on a high floor. The bed was super comfortable and soft, and the room in general was very well equipped. Staff were lovely also. I really couldn't find fault with this hotel and would definitely stay there again next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa C
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a really nice hotel, the room was lovely, the views amazing and the bed very comfy. You could even sit on the toilet and look out over the harbour(!) The one thing that spoiled it was the horrible noise of the trains which seem to run directly below the motel!!! we were on level 4 and it was quite loud but friends of our were staying further up and they said they could only just hear it. So perhaps request a room further up the tower if you plan on staying here. Otherwise overall everything was good (including the buffet breakfast) and I would probably stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View, but a few issues!”
Reviews.Author: Tree1234
Reviews.Content: The location and view are great but there are a couple of things that are worth noting about this hotel. As with previous reviews, the train vibration is continual. It did not worry me much, but if your a light sleeper and your on a lower floor, its probably going to concern you. Secondly, I found the service from reception to be variable. One of the Front Office staff is very "Transactional" - with no real concern to make you aware of any of the features or offerings of the hotel. Speed seemed to be the name of the game. The hotel room had a light bulb out in the bathroom which was fixed the following day and on one day the bathroom towels were not replaced. There is a free shoe polishing service in the mornings, which is a great idea. However being engaged in a conversation about God and conspiracy theories may not be the best approach at 730am when your in a hurry! I noticed that it was not just me who had the interesting experience. It's nice to see a small hotel making the effort to be different to the Branded ones. Perhaps the next stay will be a bit higher floor, a double bed (instead of a single) and I will polish my own shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: CoffsFamily
Reviews.Content: I travelled to this hotel directly from Sydney airport via the train and it is literally a 2 minute walk from North Sydney station. The check-in staff were friendly, efficient and provided directions to help me navigate around North Sydney. I booked a standard room (no harbour view) with a queen sized bed and the room was very clean with a functional bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. For $160 so close to the Sydney CBD this place was good value. The views from the opposite side of the building are excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Was very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: CanberraAndy10
Reviews.Content: We booked a zoo package for myself and my parents. We were given rooms side by side on the 12th floor, and the view was fantastic. Upon check-in, the staff were super friendly and helpful. On-site parking was an issue, not many spots left and the available spots were only big enough for a Barina. While we didn't eat in the restaurant for dinner, the buffet breakfast on our last day was lovely, so many options and very tasty. Everything was clean, tidy and the staff were exceptional. Rooms were very pleasant and had everything we needed for our one night stay, although the bed was very soft, something a bit firmer would have been ideal. Overall I would definately stay here again, especially with the number of different packages they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in North Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ShellDee
Reviews.Content: Good room but there is train line below hotel so can get noisy. Buffet breakfast was very good. There are not many nearby restaurants to eat at. Hotel lifts were a bit old & creaky.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: ellipsis000
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Harbourview on business for the last eighteen months and have always found the accommodation clean and comfortable. The staff are the friendliest I've ever met. The food is always good and they change the menu around with weekly specials and seasonal changes so regular guests like myself don't get bored. It's conveniently located just a few doors from North Sydney train station and the views are all spectacular. The only down side is you do get some noise from the trains running below the hotel, so if you need complete silence to sleep then this may not be the hotel for you. If, like me, you live in the city and are used to some background noise then this shouldn't worry you at all. I've heard louder noises from the TV in the room next door (just not at this hotel as this isn't an issue here).

Reviews.Title: “Great views and very handy!”
Reviews.Author: tvetting
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbourview Hotel for only one night. It was a little bit pricey but for the view and handiness to Sydney Central plus being able to see Luna Park (for our daughter) it was perfect for our one night stay. The rooms aren't big but are very nicely furnished and the bed was VERY comfortable. We ate in the restaurant and the food was very nice (breakfast and dinner). It's a short walk to shops and mall nearby and the train station. You do have to pay extra for parking which I think was AUD15 a day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book a corporate even here”
Reviews.Author: Shorty888
Reviews.Content: The company i work for recently booked a three day business conference at this hotel, Leading up to the event the events co-ordinator had changed hands 3 times. during this time they were very unprofessional with handling our event. We were invoiced for elements that we did not agree upon, They lost our name tags that e had set out ready for the next day of the event in which we held all three corporate rooms for. I must say that the food was really great for our conference at all times. The entire hotel staff that was dealing with our event obviously didn't undergo Hotel standard training. All of our staff were very pleased with the rooms & the great views. The conference rooms are directly above the train station and every time the train went through the tables shook & you could feel everything. another thing was that we were promised chilled bottled water & they came out with tap water warm & it was a stange taste. If you are to stay at this hotel ask for rooms that are on the top floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the best view, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: afterbanns
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice. It has been renovated and is really working at providing the best service. It is also a great alternative to the CBD Hotels with views which can be very costly. When booking get the best rate you can for the superior rooms which have the best views. If you get a standard room, just make sure you are above the 7th level so the train noise wont bother you. The bathrooms are basic but clean. The bedding is comfortable and the rooms are spacious. Check in and check out were very smooth with efficient and friendly staff. Lots of onsite, free parking. There is a nice bar and restaurant downstairs. Room service breakfast could have been better but not a complete disaster.

Reviews.Title: “I freaking love this place!”
Reviews.Author: hay_renay
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 5 times over the last year! I keep going back because everything is so perfect! It's clean, it has amazing views and is cheap! $180 a night for a awesome view, why pay $350 at the Shangrila! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Harbourview North Sydney - a Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalCitizen01
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay in North Sydney as my company's head office is located there. I have in the past always stayed at Rydges North Sydney due to it's proximity to my office, however as service and quality there has become questionable I looked for an alternative. The Harbourview, for some reason I had always overlooked, to me it sort f presented as an old out dated hotel - I was very wrong. Upon check in the place had a good atmosphere, there was a small band playing in the bar and it seemed fresh and alive. Arriving in my room I found a very modern and updated room, with all facilities and amenities one would expect. The cleanliness, appearance and quality was a step above Rydges. Staff service was of a high service. There is a concierge and a bell boy, something non existent at Rydges. I had to change rooms during my stay, something I was aware of at the time of booking, this was facilitated by the staff including moving my luggage. A similar experience at Rydges was the opposite, no moving of luggage etc. The food quality and choices are high. The breakfast buffet is high quality. The F&B staff are plentiful and helpful. Room service has wide array of choices and is prompt. All the opposite of Rydges down the road, where they always seem to be understaffed and room service orders regularly disappear or get lost,,,, A simple comparison to Rydges - here at Harbourview the TV channels include all the new freeview free to air channels, at Rydges they still only have the old basic free to air channels. The pricing for this stay worked out less than a comparable Rydges stay The only downside is the occasional dep noise and rumble from the train station below. It didn't take long to get used to and was hardly a major issue but it was initially nooticeable. The views are great and I would recommend this hotel to business or leisure travellers requiring a North Sydney hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable enough for the price .. book on the upper levels”
Reviews.Author: SthOz
Reviews.Content: a comfortable enough hotel with a reasonable bar and good breakfast. I suggest that anyone booking here gets an upper level room as the trans can be noisy at times. Book a room with a view of the harbour (Harbour Bridge and Lunar Park)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but great location for N. Sydney”
Reviews.Author: benboyd5
Reviews.Content: The only negative about this hotel is that it's on top of the subway. If you have a low floor you can feel the train under you. With that said, the people are great, the food was better than most hotels, and the location was pretty good. It's only a 5 minute walk to the train station from the hotel, and only a 20 minute walk to the ferry. The rooms were decently cleaned each day, no complaints there. The restaurant was very good, but for some reason the room service wasn't.. :/

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Modex
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently on business and would love my company to find another option. Our complaints centre around service, and the often mentioned noise of the train waking us up at 6am. If you do stay here, make sure you get a room at the top floors. A couple examples of poor service are (a) upon asking for a taxi, we were told to go down their driveway and fend for ourselves - I'd never copped this from a doorman in all my travels (b) when having drinks with colleagues at their bar, the bartender made it clear she could not be stuffed bringing our drinks to our table as we spoke, even though it was a quiet period. The only upside is the great view. Not worth what they charge a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and one of the best views in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Falksnviolet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and everything was perfect. The hotel is over the North Sydney railway station so we asked for a room on one of the higher level floors. On the tenth floor the low rumble of the trains was actually pleasant background sound. The view is panoramic - the night time view of the Harbour Bridge and the lights of Luna Park is stunning. An easy walk to Millsons Point to catch the ferry over to Circular Quay - or the train almost at your door. The bed was like sleeping in a cloud. Staff were friendly. A bonus is that we could open the small windows on each side of the large windows and actually have fresh air in the room - something you don't often find in high-rise hotels. Bathroom was very small but adequate. We will certainly stay there again next time we are in Sydney - thoroughly recommend as long as you get a room on a higher level.

Reviews.Title: “Train whistle blowing......or rumble, rumble ALL NIGHT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lee65
Reviews.Content: Had been recommended this hotel by a few friends, so decided to give it a try. I knew it was near North Sydney Station but I didn't know it was built OVER the railway station. Yes the view is priceless and the refurbished room was very smick, although I just don't get the window in the bathroom looking into the motel room. My teenage boys were not thrilled by the site of me waving from the shower....fully clothed or they would have died of embarrassment! We arrived late after a delayed flight & ordered room service which was very reasonably priced & very quick @ 11pm. BUT BUT BUT............it was those trains. We were on the 5th Floor & I saw that the motel does go up to the 14th Floor, but the constant noise through the night & vibration of the train on the tracks would still be felt on the top floor. It has a lot of pluses but motels are for sleeping & if you can't get a good night sleep, you may as well be out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: Benson1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Harbour View for a few days. We had organised a seminar there and so it was the best thing to do. The hotel itself is nice and the people very friendly. Only a short walk from the hotel you will find some nice restaurants which I used rather then the one in the hotel. Anyway the breakfast was okay. They offer either full choice or kind of express breakfast. The room was big enough and I even had something like a dining table with a few chairs. One thing I really disliked: The hotel is build on top of the metro terminal. On the lower floors you can feel the vibrations of the trains coming and going. Therefore, especialy when you are already jetlagged, sleeping might be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic view of the Bridge from our window”
Reviews.Author: Riever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days over Christmas and we really enjoyed having that fantastic view. Although it is technically on the "wrong" side of the bridge, we didn't find that a problem at all; it was quiet and we loved taking the ferries back and forth and walking up the (steep) hill through the residential area back to hotel. The hotel was well appointed and comfortable. We loved Sydney, the people were fab and it was a real highlight of the holiday. Get a Sydney 7 day travel pass. Unlimited travel on buses (even to Bondi) trains and boats - it'll save you loads.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff, nice area”
Reviews.Author: missfrogstomp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms during our stay as we were there for a couple of days in the week in a non-harbourview room then taking advantage of an offer over the weekend for a harbourview room. Our first room was on the second floor and while there was noise from the trains below, this wasn't enough to disturb us. Our second room was on the 9th floor and the view was simply amazing! If you're staying in Sydney for a weekend, I can't recommend the weekend package (including breakfast) highly enough. There was great selection at breakfast and the harbourview rooms have a breathtaking view, far superior to anything you'd get in the CBD (we had friends staying at the Marriott and they just had views of skyscrapers). Enough to make me want to sit and gaze out the window all day long! The hotel is in a bit of an odd position as it's quite a businessy area, but we managed to find a couple of great places to eat within 5 minutes walk, and getting the train in and out of the city was a breeze (and made the whole experience of being in Sydney feel more like a local than a tourist who only sees one area of the city). One of the highlights for me of this hotel was the vouchers for free swimming in the North Sydney Olympic pool, coming from the UK where outdoor pools are rare due to the bad weather, the experience of swimming in the 50m pool right next to the harbour bridge is one I'll never forget! If you're a keen swimmer, it's a few minutes' walk from the hotel but SO worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: NZTourists
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the hotel. Stayed 3 nights in room 312. The main view was over the railway tracks, with a view of the harbour bridge at the far right. So the view was below expectations. The room, decor & furnishings were fresh and pleasant - no complaints there. The room had air-conditioning. There was tea/coffee/biscuits in the room. Bathroom was good with shampoo/conditioner/soap provided. I highly recommend the 20 minutes walk to Blues Point for stunning views of the Harbour Bridge. Also highly recommended is the walk down to Lavender Bay, then past Luna Park to Milsons Point, where you walk under the Harbour Bridge and have a view of the Opera House. The walk over the Harbour Bridge also provides great views, & leads you to the Rocks area. A recommended local restaurant for seafood is the Sardine Room in Potts Point, a charming neigbourhood. Breakfast at the hotel was expensive: A$29.00 for the full buffet, A$23.00 for the continental breakfast with no hot food, and A$15.00 for the express breakfast (toast/breads, etc). However, the major negative of staying in room 312 was the rumbling noise from the trains - more a roar than a rumble, and definite annoying. The hotel should offer some compensation for those staying in the lower level rooms, such as free breakfast. I would not recommend staying in this hotel unless you can get a top level room. Because the hotel was full I did not request a room change.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nitesh786
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed in the Hotel from 5th March to 12th March. It was a group booking done for us. I found the hotel very neat and clean. The main attraction was the location of the hotel. The Harbour bridge facing rooms were very well maintained and the view was superb, The service was also very prompt. The food was very tasty as well.

Reviews.Title: “good base, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: trixie22
Reviews.Content: It's true that the view is great. Lovely watching all the boats on the harbour, the Bridge & Luna park. However the rooms are very ordinary; perfectly adequate and clean, but not somewhere you'd especially want to spend the day hanging out. That said, the hotel provides a good base for getting out and about being right above the Nth Sydney train station. It's nice to catch the double-decker trains across the bridge in to the CBD or to Circular Quay (on a nice day would recommend getting a ferry to Manly and doing the short seaside walk to Shelley beach, On the way back stop at the cafe upstairs right on Manly beach-I think it's called 'provisions' for a good beer and some tasty snacks with a view. Don't forget to throw your bathers in for a dip in the ocean or the lovely seaside bathing pool. Shelley beach is calm and sheltered if you have kids along). Back at the hotel, the staff are cheerful and professional (though bear in mind that in Australia this means cultivating an approachable, casual demeanor). There is a reasonable collection of cafes for breakfasts/brunch if you walk up the hill and turn left at the first intersection, some with views. Otherwise there's not much to look at or do in Nth Sydney itself. We did notice the rumble of trains in the lobby (didn't bother us), but not in our room. If you are bothered by noise request a higher floor. If you arrive by train and have large or wheelie bags you can avoid the flight of stairs to the hotel's entrance by walking a few more metres to driveway entrance, which, although a little steep,has a footpath along the side.

Reviews.Title: “romancing with a view!”
Reviews.Author: jum253
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for our anniversary, and were both surprised with the amazing value of the premium romance package we had booked. Was drawn to this hotel for the harbour views. Better views and better value than in the CBD. This business style hotel provided easy parking and check-in was very fast and efficient. Our spacious deluxe room on the 10th floor was perfect, with our sparkling wine, chocolates and chocolate dipped strawberries on arrival. Bathroom design is unique with a window allowing views of the harbour. The king bed was perfect! Made for sleep! I particularly liked the adjustable dim lighting in the room, creating a lovely romantic ambiance. We ordered room service for lunch which was great. Dinner at LB's Restaurant was amazing, with quality food and very generous portions! Breakfast selection was also very delicious. Service from staff was of a very high standard. Highly recommended hotel. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not only a great view but great food as well!”
Reviews.Author: exaussie
Reviews.Content: The view of the Sydney skyline at night was just the most amazing experience... so much so that we ordered room service (food = same price as restaurant with $3 fee!) and had the benefit of great food with a view to die for. We just loved this hotel - great beds, friendly helpful service and again - great food as a bonus. We mostly appreciated having two TWIN beds. Access to the train station is (almost) right next door and a short train ride and one change takes you right to Circular Quay with all of the action. Only one thing to note - there is no elevator at Central station to take you down/up to the platform for Nth Sydney line. We had heavy luggage so opted for a cab ride across the bridge (not too exp. anyway). I would definitely stay here again - LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Kat09kitty
Reviews.Content: I booked the "romancing with a view" package for my partner and I's anniversary. When I read the package I thought it was great value for money but by the end of the whole trip I was blown away with how amazing it was.... Our room had an amazing view of the entire city, we got 2 drink vouchers at the bar, and a loverly 3 corase dinner, and the meals couldn't be fault....They were perfect! The staff were extremely friendly and all-in-all we had a fantastic time... I found this package in the local paper and now I always read it to see if there is anywhere that can give this place a run for its money... I MUST DO!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: ankomonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 14 nights on business. The room was pretty good with a very comfortable bed. However, you're so close to the neareast station that trains did disturb my sleep. My harbour view didn't include the opera house but was a very pleasant view regardless. The staff were generally very helpful but the decor is a little outdated, particularly the lifts and corridors on the floors with rooms. I don't know the standard price for hotels in Sydney with a harbour view but I felt this hotel was pretty expensive bearing in mind it has no gym, pool, etc. Breakfast was also extortionately priced and had a very ordinary selection of foods. Overall, the location was good, the room itself was good and the staff were good, but it's pricey and quite ordinary in some ways.

Reviews.Title: “View”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Seed4
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times over the years and to my mind the selling point is the view. This is your standard 4 star business type hotel but to get the sort of view over the other side of the harbour, you would need to pay double the price and given its one minute walk from the train station and two stops and you're in town, its the view that sells it. This time I had a corner room so great view of the Harbour bridge and Luna Park but not the Opera House due to a high rise. Other times the vies has been different. The train noise is a bit of an issue but its a low rumble rather than a deafening roar. Service was friendly and efficient and the bath room has a huge window into the room so you can shower and watch the harbour (with a blind in case you want to protect your modesty). I've dines or had take away from the Italian restaurant next door a few times, always okay and lots of trendy restaurants just a short walk away

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel with great views, shame about the trains”
Reviews.Author: runbhk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great views of the Harbour Bridge, unfortunately, it sits above a train line, and you can hear and feel the trains at night. It's a little disconcerting at first. There's a train station into the the main CBD about a minutes walk from the lobby. The staff here are friendly though, and Wednesday nights it's guest meet and great night where some of the managers come meet guests over wine and / or beer. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. It's a real business hotel, and the weekends in the area are quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good.”
Reviews.Author: cebazat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas and enjoyed the festive dinner and atmosphere in the hotel over that period. The view of the Harbour Bridge from our room was fantastic. Staff as always were helpful and welcoming. Although over the railway station, we didn't notice much noise from trains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DJM2207
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the North Sydney Harbour View Hotel on 11th/12th Dec. We found the service great and the staff were very friendly, courteous and helpful. The location was great too and we had a fabulous view of Sydney Harbour. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided...”
Reviews.Author: pralinka10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights. Had a room on the 7th floor with a 'harbour view'. The view turned out to be 75% North Sydney view. We could see a glimpse of the harbour from the right corner of the window. The room was directly above the train line, so there was a bit of a humming noise every time a train went by and magnified when two trains went by at the same time. Somehow, the noise didn't bother us, but I guess it would have been a different story if we were on a lowe floor. The room was clean, had a fridge, TV, air con and a comfortable bed. Nothing special about it. Internet connection was available, but for $13.95 PER HOUR! We decided to use internet cafes and free wi-fi around town instead. Parking wasn't cheap either - $15 per day. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, slightly overpriced for a 4 star hotel, which doesn't offer anything but a supposed harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great view, good service - very good if you stay in North Sydney”
Reviews.Author: punir
Reviews.Content: I stayed 9 nights and received a room in the 11th floor. The view is beautiful to the Lavender bay and the bridge. The room is nice, clean and pleasant. 1 minute walk to North Sydney train station. Staff very polite and keen to help. Good breakfast. You may get a complimentary newspaper every morning. If your business in mainly north to the bridge this might be a great choice. Be aware that the train is passing beneath the hotel so I'm not sure how quiet are lower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “All round value and quality.”
Reviews.Author: PidynTeithio
Reviews.Content: Have been here a number of times now and have been impressed every time. Good service, good food, good rooms and close to transport. The trains, on occaision are noticable but not to the extent it affects sleep (and I am easily woken). A short train or taxi ride and you're in the city or a walk down the hill to the ferry and Luna Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view and catch the ferry!”
Reviews.Author: Artemide1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a conference and it lived up to expectations (recommended by a friend). Great view, though I was only on the 3rd floor from where I suspect train noises are louder than higher floors (but didnt bother me much). Close to Milson's Point AND McMahon's Point ferry terminals and I would highly recommended taking the ferries and walking or catching bus up to the North Sydney station as it is just near the station. In contrast to another reviewer, i DID find great restaurnant etc nearby as there are quite a few in Blues Point Rd only a 5-10 minute walk away. To enjoy this place you must walk! Mary McKillop Place and her tomb and museum etc are also 5 mins rom the hotel (if you are into Saints!). The hotel has no pool but they give you a pass to the Nth Sydney Olympic Pool which is well worth a visit even just for the view once again! But the pool is also great for laps and is salt rather than chlorine. Right under the bridge next to Luna Park. Staff were friendly and hotel very clean and no problem with noise. There's a restaurant I didnt try though I had a drink there one night, nice atmosphere. Great place, I recommend it (not cheap of course, though I got a reasonable discount for 4 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel.. and what a view!”
Reviews.Author: PJLBewdy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbourview for three nights over the October long weekend. This was our 4th stay at this hotel and it didn't disappoint. Check-In - Pleasant and efficient. Not particularly personal. Room - Recently refurbished. Everything works well. We were in 914 which doesn't have the classic Harborview outlook over Lavender Bay to the Bridge and Sydney skyline but a vista looking up the harbour which grows on you. Bathroom is small. Bed - Queen. Really really good. Luxurious with high quality linen. Sleep Quality - I didn't sleep well but I don't think that's the hotel's fault - the train noise was detectable on the ninth floor but not really a problem Bar - friendly bar staff, good range of drinks and prices aren't as ridiculous as a lot of hotels. Dining Room - We had dinner 'in' one night and the restaurant compared very favourably to the more fancied ones we had dined at on other nights. Great food and service. Breakfast - Nice place to sit. I guess being the long weekend it was as crowded as it ever gets but I found the service brusque and impersonal and the food acceptable but not anything to rave about. General Location - the hotel is very conveniently located for train access to the city, short walk to ferries. It's also very nice to walk around the harbour foreshore or over the bridge. To summarise: The hotel is good but not great - it offers proximity to Sydney without being fast paced or ridiculously expensive. One look out of the window will leave you in no doubt about your location.

Reviews.Title: “Single glazed windows on top of a busy train line”
Reviews.Author: traceur
Reviews.Content: If you intend to sleep, bring ear plugs. The hotel is literally on top of a highway and a train line, with a long bend in it (i.e. â€“ screeching trains). More importantly, the hotel windows are not double glazed, so itâ€™s like having the trains and trucks stop inside your room. I am a fairly well-seasoned traveller and have a high tolerance for noise, but I barely managed to fall asleep with the aid of earplugs. As a result, I have recommended that this hotel be taken off the list of preferred hotels for our business. The rooms are tidy, but small. The standard room does not have a bath, just a shower. The service was friendly and sympathetic - it's not the staff's fault the hotel's owners decided to save money on noise proofing. The view is fantastic, but I'd prefer to look at it for 15 minutes and then sleep, not stare at the Harbour Bridge while listening to train noise.

Reviews.Title: “Allways have a great stay”
Reviews.Author: JPDouwnunder
Reviews.Content: Views to die for here, restaurants just fabulous ( pork belly & scallops!), location is perfect over the NS station and value excellent. I enjoy the bar , the rooms and just love coming here. Its not a 5 star as such but all the better it's so good

Reviews.Title: “Only worth for the view”
Reviews.Author: ezymove
Reviews.Content: if you go there: do it for the view. Service is average, the train runs until late and it feels like an earthquake every time or a plane just passing next to room. If you are looking for a great view choose rooms further up than 2nd floor more located to the middle and right side facing the bay. Internet is a fiasko $13 for an hour and you have to register. Just located next to north sydney station....

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in a cloud with a view”
Reviews.Author: DamoTassie
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to pass on my thanks for a great stay over the weekend. The service throughout the hotel was second to none and what more can I say about the view...It was also refreshing to see accommodation that was of a high standard and not looking tired. And the bed...it was like sleeping in a cloud.... Ask for a high floor as the train noise 9North Sydney Train station is under the building) can be a real pain lower down....but the view is WORTH IT!!!!! Check out my photos...

Reviews.Title: “View to Die For”
Reviews.Author: nataliegoes
Reviews.Content: The view was unbelievable. I think it is even better than being in the city, because you can see the city. We loved the North Sydney area, great variety of restaurants between here and Milson's Point. Big commercial buildings, surrounded by quaint old neighborhoods and seaside parks and Luna park. Being right next to the train station was a huge benefit. Do expect to pay dearly for any extras. Internet $25 a day, breakfast $20 a day, local calls $5 a day, parking also extra. Include those in your budget, but it is probably still worth it for the view alone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, rude staff... and train tracks running right below!”
Reviews.Author: QuiteTheNomad
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the views magnificent - but be warned! One half of the hotel sits over train tracks and the trains are audible enough to disturb sleep even if your room is as high as the 13th floor!!! I booked a 'Harbour View Bay Deluxe Room' and specifically requested an early check in since I would be arriving in Sydney at 7am, after a 36 hour journey across the globe. Upon arrival I was told that yes, my request had been 'entered in the system' but that the room allocated to me had not yet been vacated, and that I could either wait in the lobby/restaurant or take one of the other rooms that was free. When I asked if I was being offered a similar room to the one I had paid for, the receptionist admitted it was not as nice, as it looked out on the other side (kind of defeating the point of the Harbour View) but it was all they had at the time. Tired as I was, I specifically asked if I could use the other room 'for the time being' so that I could just have a shower and step out into the city. At this point I was told it would be okay, IF the other room had been vacated and cleaned out by the time I wanted to shift rooms. Seemed reasonable, so I went ahead and had a shower in the 'substitute' room, but having noticed how loudly I could hear the trains thundering past 13 floors below (!!!!!!!!) I was determined to be moved to the other side, where my original allotted room was. Before I headed to reception, I checked on the room that had been pointed out to me as 'the one marked for you' (I think it was 1310 but my memory is foggy now, given how little sleep I had in the end!) and saw that it was being cleaned. I left my keys at reception, told them I had left everything packed and ready to be moved, and that I would be very grateful if they could change my rooms especially as the noise from the trains would make sleep impossible in the substitute room. When I got back in the evening, though, I found that the staff at reception had changed - but my room had not!! Worse I was told that there was 'no question' of their giving me a different room since I had used another room, and so they would have had to pay for it to be cleaned twice!! Needless to add, even the substitute room that I had used had not been cleaned, the towels not replaced, the water not refilled... and of course, the trains still thundered past!! Next morning at breakfast, I met a gentleman who was also travelling for business and struck up conversation with me by asking what I thought about the trains crashing past every 15 mins! Clearly I wasn't the only one to have found it hard to fall asleep in this hotel! I suppose the hotel cannot help the location, nor the train schedule - but what they can do is perhaps improve the soundproofing of their rooms? And certainly they can change the behaviour of the staff at reception, because as a business traveller paying nearly $200 for a room I certainly expect to be treated with a little more respect, and yes, a clean set of towels at the very least!!

Reviews.Title: “Good short stay”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights for a work trip. Good comfy bed with substantial curtains that block the light. Excellent views. Parking onsite which is a must where it is located. Noise form the trains is noticeable but I still managed good sleeps as the curtains did their job and the bed was very comfortable. 12 AUD gym passes available to Fitness First but the gym is looking really grotty and I would not use again. No fault of the hotel but they should try and get access to the other North Sydney Fitness First. Room service was good and staff were all friendly and effiicient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: summerhillblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband whilst on business for which it was ideally located in North Sydney, but moved to an appartment in Darling Harbour for a few days for some vacation time which was a much better location for all of the tourist attractions. Great views to be had from the 9th floor upwards but make sure you get a room in the middle of the corridor or you will not have the best view- If you get room number 15 on each floor you won't be able to see the harbour bridge at all.. Very comfortable bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great views /Value for money”
Reviews.Author: greigy
Reviews.Content: We atayed here for a Saturday night and were so surprised to see the magnificent view we had from our room. It was a special offer of $199 for the night which included our room, parking and breakfast. Worth every cent. We sat and enjoy a glass of wine while viewing this beautiful city. The room was small but had everything we needed. It was nicely decorated and very clean. We also received a Sunday paper for free. The breakfast was busy, a bit of a noisy place but the food was lovely and always a constant supply. If you are going to see a show or just to get away for 1 night this is a great place. If you are also going to the Kirribilli markets it is the ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schmidtlock
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here probably 20 times over the last year because of a project that I've been working on in North Sydney. The location is good if you need to be in the North Sydney business district. Great views over the harbour from every room that I've stayed in. However, the price (AUD 190-300) is just too high for the average rooms, quite dated hallways/elevators and average service and restaurant. I can't help but think that the hotels in North Sydney take advantage of the fact that the number of business hotels in the district is quite limited (which is strange considering the large number of companies with offices there). Ask for a room in the western part of the building, away from the rail line that runs underneath the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It really is a Harbour View!”
Reviews.Author: provencepassion
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the good reivews about this hotel, especially the location and proximity to the station. We had a full close view of the harbour bridge, so sunrise and sunset was a real treat! Excellent breakfast - first time I've seen honeycomb on the buffet table. Couldn't really fault a thing. Parking underground was secure and reasonably priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: pphp
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights over Easter. The rooms are great and view is divine - straight out to the hrabour bridge. Beds very comfortable and the food in the restaurant was excellent. The food plus service in the restaurant was very good. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base in North Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Saschi101
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney regularly for work and as my company has relocated across the bridge, I now stay in North Sydney. Having stayed at Rydges, Harbourside Apartments and the Harbourview, I would certainly say that this hotel has the best location of the three, with easy access to North Sydney Station and Miller Street. If you have the right room (harbourview), you will get a spectacular view of the harbour. Well worth it on a bright summer day. The rooms are generally roomy and well-appointed with modern appliances. The facade of the hotel is dated, but the location and interior make up for this. Room service is great (I'm a big fan of their bruschetta) and generally very quick. Breakfasts can sometimes be a little hit-and-miss, with the porridge being a liquid mess for several days running. Some of the presentation is a little unappetizing at times (yet perfect on other mornings), but there is generally plenty of fruit and pastries available. I've stayed in the Sydney CBD for many years and never stayed on the other side of town until recently. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised by the Harbourview and given the right price, would consider it for personal use as it's a short train ride to the city. However, if you're looking for a big night out, this would not be the place to stay (unless you're willing to get taxis or the train). Otherwise, the location is good (for North Sydney) and the rooms better than many CBD hotels. The Harbourview quite often has good rates and at the right price, I would definitely return for personal use (naturally, I'll be back for work). It's nothing too flash, but I'd rate it as solid for its category and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a great location, recommend for families.”
Reviews.Author: lavatah
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights with our children, aged 8 and 3. It happened to be the weekend of the gay & lesbian mardi-gras and it was impossible to find affordable accommodation around the darlinghurst side of the city which is the area we know. Out of desperation, we tried this hotel after reading some positive reviews and finding it was reasonably priced. We absolutely loved it! The check-in was hassle-free (and our room was actually ready when we arrrived two and a half hours before check-in time which was an unexpected bonus). The room was clean, obviously newly refurbished and the view was amazing even from the third floor. I quite liked the little window from the bathroom because I could see the kids in the bath while sitting on the bed, and you can just pull the blind down if you want privacy. The beds were very comfortable and we all had a great sleep. You could hear the rumble of the trains underneath the hotel but this didn't bother us at all. The proximity to North Sydney station is great, it meant our 3 year old didn't have to trudge around - so easy. We loved the location, we walked down to Luna Park and the area is great. The service was excellent and I can't imagine you could get better value in Sydney. We had breakfast in the morning and it was great. We did have to pay for parking ($15 per day) but the accommodation was such great value we didn't think this was unreasonable at all. So much nicer than being in the middle of the city. Overall, it exceeded our expectations and we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, clean and convenient to rail station”
Reviews.Author: MarkK4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sydney for a week and must say that the view from this hotel was amazing! The rooms were also well appointed and the rail station is a 5 minute walk up the street. However, I would say the rail is one of the slowest I've taken in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value”
Reviews.Author: vondaz
Reviews.Content: We were in room 1111 i.e. on the 11th floor to the left of the lift if facing the harbour. The view was excellent! Seriously! It could be even better if you moved further to the right, but that would only be amazing instead of excellent. The hotel is located on the other side of the harbour from the main Sydeny downtown (or CBD as they call it), but the metro is so easy to use and only 100 yards from the hotel that it was never an issue getting to and from CBD. It is 2 stops from the hotel to the CBD. The area itself is full of businesses and offices, so at the weekend it is dead, but during the week it is buzzing. There is an ALDI nearby if you need cheap supplies. Also a few nice restaurants around the corner (5 to 10 mins stroll). Personally we loved the Blue Lavendar - lovely food and nice staff. The hotel had really friendly staff, to whom nothing was too much effort. Even of the 11th florr you can hear the rumble of the trains, but I don't think they are too disturbing and I am a really light sleeper. The room was spacious and clean and as for the bathroom design - yes it is quirky, but when you pulled the blind you couldn't see into it - not sure what more privacy a couple would need from each other. I think this is a well located hotel which offers views that hotels on the other side of the harbour would charge a fortune for.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in for ages”
Reviews.Author: CaptainVegetable
Reviews.Content: Rooms appear to be newly refurbished. Everything was spanking clean and new. Bed and pillows FANTASTICALLY comfy. Didn't pay for a room with a view, but everyone gets a view from the windows right next to the lifts, which overlook the harbour and Luna Park. Magic!! (The only bad point was that I forgot my camera - well who knew I would want it on a work trip.) Room was quiet enough although it overlooked the highway (no noise with windows closed, a little with them open) Location was very convenient for me as just down the road from the office - although I know North Sydney after dark is not really a restaurant/nightlife kind of place. Wish I had the chance to use the passes to the swimming pool. Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great position,staff and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a treasure. Fantastic views and really helpful friendly staff. Great location with lots of cheaper cafes and restaurants close by. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with the most amazing view”
Reviews.Author: cchow13
Reviews.Content: I was here with hubby and 2 young kids for New Year's Eve. We wanted to see the NYE fireworks but with 2 young kids, we won't game enough to fight with the crowd at the various vantage points. We decided we have to stay somewhere with a view of the harbour bridge. I did lots of calling around and many of the hotels were already fully booked (even though it cost so much more to stay the night on NYE). I managed to find Harbourview North Sydney after lots of searching. I was a little skeptical about this place 'cos I haven't heard about this hotel before and their website didn't impress me. However, after speaking with the sales person at the hotel, I was sold as she promised me a room with a good view of the harbour bridge (even though the cost of the room increased almost 10 times on NYE). I wasn't disappointed at all. In fact, I am so happy with my stay here that I will come back again. The view was amazing. We were on the 9th floor and every morning, you wake up with the harbour bridge right in front of you. Not surprisingly, we kept our blinds open till very late at night 'cos we just can't get enough of the view. The room is standard hotel room size but they went through a multi million dollar refurb in 2008 so the room is very modern and nice. The hotel exterior and lifts still look a little dated but inside of the room, fabulous. The staff were great too. Great service, very friendly, understanding and knew the area well. Location of the hotel is great too. Minutes away from North Sydney train station. You can also take a ferry from Milsons Point. Greenwood plaza is round the corner so easy to get supplies. There is also an Aldi nearby. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. The only thing I didn't really like about this place is parking. You have to pay for parking ($15 per day) even though you are a hotel guest. And if you plan to stay over NYE, bear in mind you can't park in the hotel on NYE, you have to move your car to the nearby Wilsons Parking and they charge you $65 for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and close to CBD”
Reviews.Author: cheets
Reviews.Content: Overall: assuming you're not fussy about being IN the Sydney CBD, this is a great place. Location: two metro stops across the harbour from Sydney CBD and immediately adjacent to the North Sydney station. A few blocks from the bridge itself, so walking is a fun option. View: spectacular! Bridge, CBD, and harbour splayed out for you. In case you're insistent on seeing the Opera House, it was blocked by another Nth Sydney building (from our room, at least). Service: everyone was very helpful when solicited. Rooms: clean, spacious, on the modern side (in a good way, not in a masking-spartan-with-trendiness way).

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: YuudaiKot
Reviews.Content: This is a beautful hotel. Our rooms had a wonderful view over the Sydney Bridge Harbour. it is very easy to access to many places in the city, because there are train station and buses just around. however, due to this, some time, it would be a litle noisy. The dished were delicious, the staff were very polite and helpful. i satisfied with my choice here. the price was reasonable in a big cities like Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent views and great value”
Reviews.Author: gojo67
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for our wedding anniversary and were very pleased. We couldn't say anything bad about the stay, at all. We had heard about the hotel for years and are not sure why we hadn't tried it before! It was a very pleasant surprise. We stayed on the romancing the view package, which includes dinner, bed, breakfast, parking, plus chocolates and a bottle of bubbly waiting in your mini bar (plus 12pm checkout!)! Great value at $229 for a Friday night. The food, service and room were all good. The view was amazing, overlooking the harbour bridge and city. Was a $18 cab fare to the city and quick train ride back. I would stay here again, in preference to staying in the city. You get the view and are a bit removed form the crowds. The room was nice. It had a plasma and a window from the bathroom so you could see the view from the shower! Nice touch! I've stayed in plusher rooms and more upmarket hotels, but don't think we have had better value in an Australian hotel. My hubby is 5 star kind of guy and he was pleased with the room!! (may have had something to do with the plasma tv!!) Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel with tacky revamp - fabulos views, poor amenities”
Reviews.Author: TW_Auck
Reviews.Content: So ive stayed at this property over 40 times in the last 20 years! Im motivated to write this to make fellow travellers aware... This hotel has been renovated, but there are issues 1. The lifts are very old and somewhat dis functional... you can wait and wait and wait... and in wonderful Aussie fashion the lift service guys turned off one of the two lifts lift at 8am on a Monday... thanks guys... 2. The room access cards are circa 1972.. every day through my stay i have had to go to reception to get my card re programed... and have been curtly told its my fault for storing my card in my wallet.. or near a cell phone.. rather poor attitude... having old 1970's room access technology that uses substandard mag cards is hardly my fault... suggest they fix this - the system really is the same one that was here in the 1970's... 3. My room safe doesn't work, keeps saying the battery is flat... im too scared to tell them as likely they will say its my fault for trying to use it!! 4. The shower dribbles water... im on L14... but would expect to get more than a dribble of water on me... again an issue thats been with this place for years... poor plumbing?? On the positive side the view as stated is the best. The beds are nice and very comfortable... So yes good value, but sloppy attention to detail and plainly the owner isnt willing to update and maintain anything more than superficial details...

Reviews.Title: “Million dollar view, not price”
Reviews.Author: intljeff
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 days at the Harbour View Hotel in North Sydney for business. Our company held a seminar at the hotel, and the service was outstanding. The staff went above and beyond to help and make us feel at home, and even gave us use of their kitchen during the seminar (which was needed due to it being a food related seminar). Most all rooms have a view of Sydney Harbour and the bridge, some better than others. I stayed in room 1305 and can't believe that there was a better view (see attached photo). Room rate was under US$200 including a buffet breakfast that was great. Located right near the North Sydney train station. The train system does run under the hotel, and can be heard and felt from the lobby, and occasionally from the rooms. However, I never heard or felt the trains while sleeping. Room was modern and clean, a good size with flat screen TV. Several restaurants and pubs within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good but definitely needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: damianj85
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really nice - looks like the rooms have been recently renovated, big enough. Great view. BUT there is a problem for those who are light sleepers - or easily disturbed by noises. The hotel really needs to be fully sound proofed. I stayed a few nights on the first floor and the noise of the trains was similar to staying under a flight path (I couldn't believe trains could make so much noise). Luckily noises don't bother me when I sleep.
