After a few nights I asked to move to a higher level (even for me it became annoying - every 10 minutes), and this eased the train noise, but there was another problem. The new room had one of those interconnecting doors to another room (which was closed obviously). But it wasn't sound proofed - I heard someone belch loudly! not pleasant. Could also tell when they were watching TV, slammed the door or were on the phone - lucky they weren't noisy neighbours. Great for over night stays - but much longer and the train noise will annoy you. Make sure you are on a floor above 10. In-room internet is HELL EXPENSIVE! $25 for 24 hours, or $50 for 10 "flexi-hours" - RIP OFF! I was on business so luckily wasn't paying. I would stay here again on holiday if I could get a bargain room rate of under $140 - but other than that it is not worth it, find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, near CBD hotel with stunning views and very good service”
Reviews.Author: oneword
Reviews.Content: The Harbour View Hotel in North Sydney has had a long and chequered history. Built above busy North Sydney rail station, it started out as a Travelodge, then was rebadged as a Centra business hotel, passed through some independent operators and now itâ€™s the Harbour View, part of the fledgling View chain of properties in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane. Up front, let's be honest about its position. The hotel was built right above the train tracks on the busy northern metro line. That does make for some background noise and the occasional rumble but it's not overly intrusive. Now the positives. The hotel has been completely refurbished. It needed it. Prior to the total makeover, it was extremely tired and sad. The refurb has been an outstanding success. Tasteful, warm tones with a pleasing mix of timber, marble and modern finishes. When this hotel was constructed, the Australian hotel industry was going through its â€˜small is goodâ€™ period. Guest rooms are on the small side. I recommend paying a little extra for the â€˜bayviewâ€™ rooms. There is one on either end of the hotel. They are larger and feature a king rather than queen bed. The additional space is worth it. Most rooms boast outstanding views of the prettiest harbour in the world. The hotel was designed in a U-shape which maximises exposure to Sydney Harbour, its famous bridge and a dynamic cityscape. In fact, the view kept the property going through its lean times. There are few like it from other Sydney hotels, even those that cheekily but not always accurately sell themselves as having harbour views. Room interiors are very pleasing, especially for guests who remember the depressing, basic, concrete box that used to greet them in years past. Use of timber and soft fabric highlights is both clever and welcoming. These earthy touches complement the funky chocolate carpet and red highlights in lamp shades, pillows and the bed cover. In our end-room, there was a writing desk, as well as a small dining table and several comfortable chairs. Quite generous, really. The bed was superb â€“ that rare combination of luxurious softness with the right amount of support. The bathrooms are small but elegant and functional. Almost all the kit is there â€“ hair dryer, generous stocks of toiletries - and interestingly, toothpaste but no complimentary toothbrush. The mini-bar is adequate and not overpriced by in-room standards. We also sampled room service on two occasions. It was quick, the food reasonably priced and tasty. There is a good sized and friendly bar on the ground floor, along with a very pleasant all-day dining venue which serves quality food at upper-mid prices. Again, the view is terrific. On-site parking is limited and costs $15 per day, unless you can negotiate it in an all-inclusive rate. What was particularly pleasing during our stay was the consistently good service at this hotel. I think it comes from the Harbour View knowing exactly what it is: a non-pretentious 4-star hotel located in a Monday-to-Friday â€˜satelliteâ€™ business district that relies on repeat business to survive. All of the staff â€“ from reception to bar to restaurant to room service to housekeeping â€“ were generously pleasant and helpful without overdoing it. The management team at the Harbour View are clearly doing something right because their people seem happy, confident and willing to put themselves out for their guests. Sadly, these are qualities that arenâ€™t overly abundant in the Australian hospitality industry. So, it comes as a refreshing surprise. Overall, the Harbour View at North Sydney is a terrific short-stay business hotel that would double, very satisfactorily, for interstate and overseas visitors who are seeking out (a) a great view of fabulous Sydney Harbour, (b) better value than luxury CBD hotels can offer, and (c) an upmarket hotel in close proximity to the city â€“ youâ€™re a 5 minute train ride away and there is a cab rank, right outside the hotel. For what it is â€“ a convenient, pleasant, totally unpretentious, quality hotel â€“ the Harbour View is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: travel_tragicSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been refurbished since 2007 and while the room was small it was clean and functional. The bed was large and very comfy. The view was good of the Sydney Harbour Bridge was good, the staff freindly and helpful and the breakfast in the restaurant was good. Access top transport could not be better, a train station is below and busses outside the door. It is also only a half hour walk, with stunning views, across the Bridge to get to the other side of the harbour. The only minus was the slight rumble of trains that could be heard as they passed through the rail station below. Overall you get what you pay for and as Sydney is a very expensive city for hotels, it was reasonable value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “great views from a soft bed”
Reviews.Author: kiraywm
Reviews.Content: For the price paid, my room was fantastic, with sweeping views of the harbour from the comfort of the bed. The bed was very soft and comfortable, and the bathroom was clean (amenities were basic). On the bad side, I could hear the trains rumbling from underneath every so often. The location of the hotel by foot isn't great, you either have to drive in (carpark is such a tight squeeze!!) or enter via a long flight of stairs by foot from the street, if arriving by train. Not recommended if you don't have a car and have a lot of luggage!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanyatia
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for one night prior to a trip overseas. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Rooms were a decent size & well presented. Had previously stayed here prior to their major renovations & you would hardly think it is the same place. Very classy decor. Extremely comfortable bed, great breakfast & we also ate at the hotel for dinner. All was reasonable in price. View from our room was awesome. Loved also that you could open small windows to let in fresh air. Parked on site with no issues. Taxi into Darling Harbour or City about $20AUD which means staying here rather than a more expensive Darling Harbour/City Hotel can save you money. Would certainly return to the Harbourview.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special - I would say 4.5 out of 10....”
Reviews.Author: chuckles-a-lot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with partner (was a work gift) on the 'romance $329.00 package'. We were given a room that had no bridge view unless you really had a good look (and stretched) out the window. I called reception and asked to be moved as the package states â€œdeluxe harbour view roomâ€�. They were VERY GOOD indeed and moved us to the top floor with a great view of the harbour and bridge. The hotel really needs balconies and much better single-pane windows. TIP - for a great view you need to be on level 6 or above I would say, plus ensure the room is number â€œ01 through to about 07 maxâ€�. So, wine was in room as part of package. Strawberry dipped chocolates were nice however no separate chocolates as promised in the package. 2-for-1 drinks voucher was included and all fine however the dinner (as expected) was pretty, pretty badâ€¦. Cold and bland. To this the restaurant area is very clinical and had no atmosphere at all. We had a few bites and went back to the room. The bar areas was ok though; a bit clinical but ok for 1 or 2 drinks max. Breakfast was poor to be honest - not a great choice and again quite cold/bland. The Hyatt in Perth and Langham Place in Hong Kong both have AMAZING buffet breakfasts; all hotels should use these two as a basis! Parking was included and fine however a very tight squeeze indeed. Room service was fairly quick and fine. Prices of room service and mini-bar were ok as with most Aussie hotels; (thatâ€™s if you are from US/EU of course!).. The room was just ok however the building is such a bad â€˜oldâ€™ design and probably needs to be pulled down, as do most buildings in North Sydney, McMahons Point and Lavender Bay that make NO real use of the wonderful views on offer. Dont get me started on Blues Point Tower!! The hotel has recently had a A$9 million make over however the layout of the room was quite poor plus the finishing were very bad, e.g. - poor paint and tileing etc. Not a great choice on the TV either; no news, music or non-English channels for overseas guests. To this the shower looked nice however had the ceiling based tap right by the wall and was running at about 25% power which was just a joke! All in all - itâ€™s ok; nothing really, really wrong but nothing good/great either. Probably ok for a night or two if you are on business in North Sydney. The staff were very nice however. I would say 4.5 out of 10 - fairly well priced for what you getâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Claire&Colin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a weekend on business and found it a great hotel. The views from the rooms are simply amazing/ the rooms are comfortable and breakfast very good. THere was a lovely market on the Sunday only five minutes walkaway selling lots of beautiful handi crafts at some great prices - I bought two paintings/ all my Christmas cards and some beautiful hand made clothes. You can walk in twenty minutes over the bridge which in good weather is a joy and you are only two train stops if you run out of energy. Very good value for money and a lovely spot.

Reviews.Title: “stunning views”
Reviews.Author: louiscoco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this recently renovated hotel and it was very nice. The views from our 11th floor queen room was amazing, uninterupted views of the bridge and Luna park from a very large window. The room was a little small but for us this was not a problem. Everything is very nice, clean and modern.With the last minute price it was indeed good value for money. Easy access to the train station and a very pleasant 15 minute strolll to the Milsons point ferry across to circular quay. Service was very friendly and efficient, one draw back was the minimum fee of $19.95 in room for WIFI which is a little steep just to check your mail! Al in all a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BigBadDoug
Reviews.Content: The property has a 5 star feel at a reasonable price. I have stayed at similarly priced properties close to this location and have been bitterly disappointed. The Harbourview exceeded expectations by a mile. Great friendly staff, great decor and a magnificent restaurant. They also have an amazing little piano bar where I spent a great Saturday night talking to interesting people and listening to great music. I would thoroughly recommend to anyone looking for that little bit extra but still at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: GoGo57
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days with my husband, who was in Sydney on business. LOCATION: The hotel was close to his office, and to mine, so I was able to drop in and say hello to some fellow coworkers in my company too. The hotel is located above the North Sydney train station, two stops away from the Central Business District, and close to 3 ferry stops (Kirribilli, Milson's McMahon) so it was extremely easy to get around the city from this location. The hotel is also close to a taxi "rank" so transportation was no issue at all. It does get quiet in this area at night, but there are places to go like the Rag and Famish for pub food, and the Lavender Blue restaurant for incredible dinners (the latter is wonderful). Also, the Crow's Nest area was just a quick taxi ride away for additional food choices. There were many services in the area, like post, chemist, food market, take-away, and retail shopping. ACCOMMODATIONS: The hotel itself was fine - even under construction. I rate it "above average" because the management and staff were so helpful, friendly, warm, and empowered. Our room was one of the upgraded ones, our views were lovely any time of day or night, even in wintry weather. We felt the train rumble by occasionally, and coming from California, we initially thought "earthquake!" but soon it became unnoticeable. FOOD: The buffet breakfast was delicious and extensive and special orders were taken with no hesitation. We ordered room service several nights - 24-hour service was great since our internal clocks weren't always on local time. STAFF: All of the hotel staff was friendly and helpful, even the construction workers, but the person who made our stay most memorable and enjoyable was Johnny, who worked in food and beverage. His warmth and attentiveness made us feel like VIPs our entire stay. Thanks, Johnny, for all of your help and service! I recommend this hotel to any adult who wants a comfortable, safe, well-located place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second home”
Reviews.Author: kanchom
Reviews.Content: Heared ad on radio, as we had a free weekend coming up decided to give it a go. From sunny Newcastle & love the hustle & bussle of the big city but not the driving, Harbour View because of its convenient location gave us the option to comute using public train system (5 stops from Central Station ) no hassle trying to find park etc. View outstanding, food excellent, service good & very friendly. We have always been made to feel welcome & stayed at this hotel on quite a regular basis & always recomend it to our family & friends

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up for Harbourview Hotel North Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: ashika_969
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Harbourview Hotel North Sydney and I loved their service and meals. I donâ€™t often travel to North Sydney and I donâ€™t know my way around there but I found this very easy with the very helpful staff there. The morning breakfast buffet was the best ever breakfast feed I have had outside of home. I give two thumbs up for Harbourview Hotel North Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “tired and musty”
Reviews.Author: flairessential
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location as had functions on the north side to attend. Our room was on the eighth floor and whilst had bay views it also overlooked busy freeway and was directly above noisy trainline. The room smelt musty and the couches and bed spreads were stained. Bathroom small and dated. I viewed 2 other rooms which reeked of cigarette smoke and the staff informed me that all the rooms are affected by the train noise and vibrate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: travelfan3
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe the view!! It is so amazing I have booked there for New Years Eve and am counting down the days! The staff were also fantastic, always willing to help and I have been to many hotels and not experienced this kind of service. I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, needs freshen up”
Reviews.Author: wap13
Reviews.Content: The harbourview hotel in North Sydney is mostly a business travel hotel, located in North Sydney, accross from harbour bridge in the corporate district. The facilities (parking, lobby...) are good, the rooms can be average to good. You will need to get a room above the 6th floor or you will hear and feel the commuter train passing below the hotel. The bedrooms with view on the harbour have a breathtaking view. The sunste is one of the most beatifull and famous, on the sydney skyline and the opera house. The furniture and decoration are functional but dated and could use some refresh.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: 0traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on a special deal over the weekend. It was great! The view of the Harbour Bridge is gorgeous. Staff is very friendly and the service was excellent. The breakfast buffet was very good too! The hotel was conveniently located next to a train station, which made our trips to the city a lot easier and quicker. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views!”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at this hotel for one night - and it was pretty good. The building is really old and the rooms are kept up to date and refurbished well. Good carpet, nice bedding, light fittings etc. Decent sized room. The furniture was your usual hotel - great desk. TV cabinet, bedside table, wardrobe a bit bashed but good quality. spotlessly clean, everything in working order and good repair. Mini bar and tea/coffee, iron and board, hairdryer, internet cable etc the bathroom is small - obviously old but with a granite benchtop stuck in. good quality toiletries. average towels. Good location at North Sydney rail station with buses and taxis at the door. car parking is a bit limited - but they sorted it all out. service is very good - had the room service breakfast and it arrived on time and was pretty good quality. The best thing is the view - it is SUPER - up and down the harbour, across at the Bridge and the city. AND I got a GREAT price

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide Tripper
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Stayed with 2 grandchildren and it was comfortable with lovely views. Rooms a little dated but beds comfortable. Breakfast included and was a good selection of buffet. I would definitely stay again, although the train line runs somewhere underneath it didn't disturb us greatly. Lobby bar was relaxing and staff extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's a business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bizotraveller
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney many times and have probably stayed at the harbourview on about 20-30 nights in 2006. Reality is that it is your typical business traveller hotel. One of the best hotel views in Sydney and believe me, I have stayed in a lot of them. If you want luxurious service, exquisite meals and someone to change your clothes for you then this is really not the hotel for you. Better to stay up in the higher levels as the trains pass directly underneath and you won't hear them as much. All rooms have a view of the harbour (hence the name!). Close to Nth Sydney train station which is about a 10 min ride into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: a_scott_35
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Year's eve. The Hotel is old and run down. Definately very far form being 4 star. We struggled up the stairs with our bags while the bellmen watched. Lobby is shabby. Rooms are old and bed covers stained. Bathroom mirror was falling off and we could see the hotel pipes behind it. Room service arrived on paper plates with plastic cutlery. The view should be great, but we had a corner room and couldn't see the bridge. Price we paid was a rip off (Â£300 for the night). There were a que of people complaining when we tried to speak to the manager the next day. Really, don't go.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst”
Reviews.Author: shoegal911
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed in this hotel for the couples package with Luna Park. The run down lobby and poor customer service was our first surprise. The room had 3 lights out and the hot water wasn't working. The buffet in the morning was disgusting. The best part wsa the view, luna park and getting the hell out of there. My advice is stay well away.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good; but lacking in some areas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night only at the end of a 3 week trip through Australia and New Zealand. I agree with others: great view, good service, but limited room space, limited internet availability, and serious problems with the climate control system. The heater did not work at all, making the temperature in our room at night very cold. The location is OK; very close to train station, but I still much prefer to stay at a hotel in the city centre, as we did during the early portion of our journey.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel...loved it:)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my hubby and my child stayed there and it was awesome,199 a night and that included hot buffy brekky for the 3 of us per day. it was fantastic. the bath in the bathroom was fablous also.............so close to the trains and the thai restrurant...called thai thanic...which is in blue point rd......loved that also,,, 10/10 ill be coming back for sure. cheap drinks at the bar too that was great.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Tired and Limited Internet Availability”
Reviews.Author: phoenixgrb
Reviews.Content: You should know that this hotel is very noisy - the train runs underneath from 5 am to 12 pm so there is a short window for a good sleep. It is tired and most importantly for me, this hotel has a $30AUD Adsl internet connection with a 100 megabyte limit per day. I am in the the software business and this is unacceptable - and the download speeds are pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good; great view, but lacking the finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Others have raved about the view, and it really is spectacular - and that's coming from someone who's not rapt with views. I spent some time getting excellent city night photos from the lift lobby in the hotel. Only thing you can't see is the Opera House thanks to the Samsung building being in the way. However, once you're over the view and it comes to living in your room, things start to deteriorate. My first impression was an 80's looking card reader system on the door, which didn't always work. Once I got the door open, it hit the doorstop before it was open even 90 degrees. This was due to the entrance way being quite narrow. So not a great start. Once in the room, it was adequately and attractively furnished - the bed and bedhead in particular were quite nice, although it was a double bed (as was advertised) not a queen which would be normal for a room of this status. I guess the biggest problem is that the space available for each room is pretty small, so they've had to do the best they can with limited space. Therefore, double bed rather than queen. Bathroom has a standing area of about 1m x 1m, plus toilet space and shower/bath, which is OK for one person, but two would be getting a bit cosy. The entrance way would be less than 1m wide due to the hanging space being there, presumably to allow more space in the main part of the room, which is fair enough. Room was clean and neat and had all the facilities one would expect, but with a few rough edges here and there. The desktop and vanity unit had the look of marble, but in fact were just plastic, though done quite well. The A/C control system looks 70's - 80's; the temperature dial (yes, dial) seems to be in Fahrenheit, though the system still works OK. There were a few other little issues; staff were quick to do the best they could to rectify but the fact they happened took the shine off a little: * One of the chairs had a screw which came through the cushion and gave me quite a surprise - was replaced quickly by maintenance * A night shirt went missing without a trace when the sheets were changed one day - was compensated for With respect to the A/C system mentioned by another reviewer, apparently their system is a bit old (my comments would agree), and when the system is switched from heating to cooling or back the other way, there's about a week when it doesn't work too well. However when I was there I had no problems at all. Restaurant menu was very good, staff were friendly. All in all, I think they do the best they can to provide good service and a good experience but are limited by physical space. Therefore the cost is less than that of other hotels in the area. If you love a good view and can put up with a few rough edges for the sake of saving yourself a few dollars, you'll have a generally satisfying stay, as did I.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend from hell ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the weekend from hell at the Harbour View Hotel. NO MANAGEMENT DECISION . When we first checked in we reported the air conditioning not working. They told us to wait for 2 hours. When we came back to our room that evening it was unbearably hot. We reported the lack of aircon again and were told if we didnt like it to check out - at 11pm there was no where else to go. They told us they would let us know during the week how to compensate our sleepless night. RUINED OUR LONG AWAITED WEEKEND COMPLETELY. WE DROVE HOME THE NEXT DAY......They gave us a 25% discount which was not satisfactory. We recommend you think twice before booking this hotel. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tjohn8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last September and had an amazing time. The hotel and our room were lovely and the staff incredibly helpful. We ate in the restaurant and the food was very good although there are plenty of good places nearby which do wonderful food if your budget can't stretch to the hotel prices. One thing I would definitely recommend is that you get a harbour view room. The view was just incredible. Waking up and seeing the harbour bridge right outside your window is amazing. Also at night you can see the whole of the city lit up. I actually just sat there for 30 minutes one night taking it all in! It may cost slightly more but I think it is well worth it. It will be one of the highlights of your trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, out of the window at least.”
Reviews.Author: Megonian
Reviews.Content: After extensive research (and not being able to on the hotel's website), we booked economy rooms in the North Sydney Harbourview Hotel through Expedia. Let me just say any pictures of the rooms on the internet must be only of their suites, because we stayed in two different rooms and they both completely destroyed our expectations. Expect bruises if more than one person goes into the bathroom at once because of its small size and whatever you do, DON'T order room service!! However, the view was spectacular of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the bus and train stations were literally 30 steps from the hotel, and although it is located in Sydney's business area (North Sydney), it is only a 15-20 min. walk across the bridge (or a short $1.10AUD train ride) to the more tourist-friendly Rocks area. The porters were extremely helpful and the live piano music at the bar lends a friendly atmosphere to the very nice lobby. We wouldn't stay there again, but only because we've already taken advantage of its views and wouldn't want to pay that much for such run-down rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: North Sydney Harbourview Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Blue Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2060, Australia
